title: Gibraltar
description: The Rock, Barbary macaques, cable car, St. Michael's Cave, WWII tunnels, and views to Africa.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Gibraltar with monkeys and the Rock.

title: Cadiz, Spain
description: Oldest city in Western Europe, golden cathedral dome, La Caleta beach, and best pescaito frito.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Cadiz with cathedral and beaches.

title: Cartagena, Spain
description: Perfectly preserved Roman theater, Art Nouveau buildings, and Spain's most surprising cruise port.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Cartagena, Spain with Roman theater.

title: Tangier, Morocco
description: Gateway where Europe meets Africa, medina maze, Café Hafa, Cap Spartel, and mint tea culture.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Tangier with medina and Café Hafa.

title: Casablanca, Morocco
description: Massive Hassan II Mosque, art-deco architecture, Rick's Café, and authentic Moroccan city energy.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Casablanca with Hassan II Mosque.

title: Tunis (La Goulette), Tunisia
description: Gateway to Carthage ruins, Sidi Bou Said blue-and-white perfection, and Tunis medina — three UNESCO sites.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Tunis with Carthage and Sidi Bou Said.

title: Zadar, Croatia
description: Roman ruins, Sea Organ playing wave music, Greeting to the Sun light show, coolest small Adriatic city.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Zadar with Sea Organ and light shows.

title: Koper, Slovenia
description: Miniature Venice with Venetian palaces, Parenzana bike trail, Istrian truffles, and Slovenian prices.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Koper with bike trails and truffles.

title: Trieste, Italy
description: Elegant Habsburg cafés, largest sea-facing piazza in Italy, Miramare Castle, and literary soul.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Trieste with Piazza Unità and cafés.

title: Bergen, Norway
description: Seven mountains, colorful Hanseatic wharf houses, Mount Fløyen funicular, fish market, gateway to fjords.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Bergen with Bryggen wharf and funicular.

title: Stavanger, Norway
description: White wooden houses, Lysefjord cruise with Pulpit Rock views, adventure capital with charm.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Stavanger with Pulpit Rock cruise.

title: Ålesund, Norway
description: Art Nouveau fairy tale rebuilt after 1904 fire, pastel buildings, Mount Aksla viewpoint, island charm.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Ålesund with Art Nouveau architecture.

title: Tromsø, Norway
description: Arctic capital with midnight sun or northern lights, Arctic Cathedral, cable car viewpoint, reindeer.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Tromsø with Arctic experiences.

title: Tallinn, Estonia
description: Perfectly preserved Hanseatic fairy tale with orange roofs, church spires, medieval walls from 1450.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Tallinn's medieval old town.

title: St. Petersburg, Russia
description: Imperial excess with golden spires, Hermitage museum, Church on Spilled Blood, canal cruises, white nights.
cta: First-person logbook guide to St. Petersburg with Hermitage.

title: Riga, Latvia
description: Art Nouveau capital of the world with Hanseatic old town and biggest market halls in Europe.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Riga with Art Nouveau district.

title: Gdansk, Poland
description: Amber capital, Solidarity birthplace, perfectly rebuilt Hanseatic façades, phoenix city from ashes.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Gdansk with Solidarity history.

title: Warnemünde, Germany
description: Perfect beach town and gateway to Berlin — Brandenburg Gate, Museum Island, Checkpoint Charlie day trip.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Warnemünde with Berlin day trip.

title: Kiel, Germany
description: Sailing capital with Olympic harbor, massive Kiel Canal locks, Laboe Naval Memorial, and U-boat museum.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Kiel with canal and U-boat.

title: Zeebrugge/Bruges, Belgium
description: Gateway to perfectly preserved medieval Bruges with canals, swans, Belfry climb, chocolate shops.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Zeebrugge/Bruges with medieval Bruges.

title: Le Havre/Paris, France
description: Realistic gateway to Paris for Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Montmartre in single (very full) day by train.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Le Havre/Paris day trip.

title: Cherbourg, France
description: Largest artificial harbor, Cité de la Mer submarine museum, D-Day beaches, Utah Beach, Normandy charm.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Cherbourg with D-Day beaches.

title: Bordeaux, France
description: Wine capital of world with Cité du Vin museum shaped like decanter, Miroir d'Eau, Saint-Émilion village.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Bordeaux with Cité du Vin.

title: Bilbao, Spain
description: Frank Gehry's titanium Guggenheim masterpiece, Puppy flower-dog, Richard Serra steel spirals, Basque pintxos.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Bilbao with Guggenheim.

title: La Coruña, Spain
description: City of Glass with 1,900-year-old Tower of Hercules lighthouse still working, glazed galerías, Riazor beach.
cta: First-person logbook guide to La Coruña with Tower of Hercules.

title: Vigo, Spain
description: Gateway to Cíes Islands Atlantic paradise with world's best beaches, Rodas Beach, limited daily visitors.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Vigo with Cíes Islands.

title: Porto (Leixões), Portugal
description: Terracotta roofs cascading to Douro, port wine lodges, São Bento station with 20,000 azulejos tiles.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Porto with port wine tasting.

title: Honfleur, France
description: Prettiest harbor in Normandy with colorful Vieux Bassin tall houses, birthplace of Impressionism.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Honfleur with Vieux Bassin.

title: Gothenburg, Sweden
description: Trams, Feskekôrka seafood fish church, car-free southern archipelago islands, Liseberg park, Scandinavian cool.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Gothenburg with archipelago.

title: Liverpool, England
description: The Beatles, two cathedrals, best maritime museum in Britain, friendliest Scouse welcome.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Liverpool with Beatles sites.

title: Cork/Cobh, Ireland
description: Titanic's last port with tearful Pier 13 goodbyes, St. Colman's Cathedral, English Market food hall.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Cork/Cobh with Titanic Experience.

title: Invergordon, Scotland
description: Gateway to Loch Ness monster hunting, Urquhart Castle ruins, Scottish Highlands, Cawdor Castle.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Invergordon with Loch Ness.

title: Kirkwall, Orkney, Scotland
description: 5,000-year-old Skara Brae Neolithic village, Ring of Brodgar stone circle, St. Magnus Cathedral.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Kirkwall with Skara Brae.

title: Lerwick, Shetland, Scotland
description: Britain's northernmost town with Jarlshof archaeology, Sumburgh Head puffins, Up Helly Aa Vikings.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Lerwick with Jarlshof.

title: Dover, England
description: White Cliffs of Dover, Dover Castle Secret Wartime Tunnels, gateway to Canterbury and London.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Dover with White Cliffs.

title: Portland, Dorset, England
description: Jurassic Coast UNESCO site with fossil hunting, Chesil Beach, Portland Bill lighthouse, ammonites.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Portland with Jurassic Coast.

title: Newcastle upon Tyne, England
description: Angel of the North sculpture, seven Tyne bridges, Geordie warmth, best nightlife in Britain.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Newcastle with Angel of the North.

title: Holyhead, Wales
description: Gateway to Snowdonia mountains, Caernarfon Castle, longest village name in Europe, Anglesey.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Holyhead with Snowdonia.

title: Waterford, Ireland
description: Viking Triangle with Reginald's Tower, House of Waterford Crystal factory, oldest Irish city.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Waterford with crystal tour.

title: Honolulu, Oahu
description: Pearl Harbor memorial, Waikiki Beach, Diamond Head crater hike - do it all in one Hawaiian port day.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Honolulu with tips for Pearl Harbor and Waikiki.

title: Kailua-Kona, Big Island
description: Historic villages, Kona coffee farms, night manta ray snorkel - best tender port in Hawaii.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Kona with manta snorkel and coffee tours.

title: Hilo, Big Island
description: Volcanoes National Park, Rainbow Falls, Kilauea Iki crater - greenest side of the Big Island.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Hilo with Volcanoes NP and waterfall stops.

title: Maui (Kahului)
description: Iao Valley, Upcountry lavender farms, Road to Hana - Maui after the Lahaina fire (via Kahului).
cta: First-person logbook guide to Maui with post-fire port update.

title: Nawiliwili, Kauai
description: Waimea Canyon, Na Pali coast catamaran, Garden Isle - most dramatically beautiful Hawaiian island.
cta: First-person logbook guide to Kauai with Waimea Canyon and Na Pali boat.

title: Where I've Been: Port Tracker
description: Track your cruise port visits, earn bingo cards, and see how many Royal Caribbean ports you've conquered!
cta: Interactive tool to track which Royal Caribbean ports you've visited, with achievement badges and social sharing.

title: Ships I've Sailed: Ship Tracker
description: Track which Royal Caribbean ships you've sailed on, earn fleet achievement badges, and share your Royal Caribbean journey!
cta: Interactive tool to track which Royal Caribbean ships you've sailed, with fleet badges and social sharing.
